name: Phenelzine

dosing.notes: Irreversible MAOI. Strict tyramine-free diet required. 2-week washout from other antidepressants before initiating (5-week washout from fluoxetine). Take in 2-3 divided doses. Avoid evening doses due to insomnia.

canadian_clinical.starting_dose: 15 mg/day (7.5 mg BID or 15 mg each morning)
canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 15 mg/week to 45-60 mg/day. Some patients require up to 90 mg/day.
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 15 mg/day. Titrate q5-7 days. Target 45-60 mg/day. Dietary restriction education essential from Day 1.
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Comprehensive dietary education mandatory. Titrate over 4-6 weeks. Issue patient emergency card for MAOI interactions.
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 60-90 mg/day; 90 mg/day reserved for treatment-resistant cases.

cautions.hepatic: Avoid in hepatic impairment — risk of hepatotoxicity.
cautions.pregnancy: Avoid — risk of fetal harm, hypertensive crises.

warnings: CRITICAL: Hypertensive crisis with tyramine-containing foods (cheese, aged meats, wines, fava beans, etc.)
CRITICAL: Serotonin syndrome with serotonergic drugs (SSRIs, TCAs, opioids like tramadol/meperidine, triptans)
Must carry MAOI patient emergency card
2-week drug-free washout required before starting; 2 weeks required after stopping before other antidepressants
5-week washout required if switching FROM fluoxetine
Pyridoxine (B6) deficiency with long-term use — supplement recommended
